persons.name: Aeian T'Goni
persons.description: A lauded but traumatized soldier, Aeian relates in chunks her story to a psychiatrist in the entrance hall of Herta Memorial Hospital. She was sent to assist in the evacuation of Tiptree, but was overrun by Reaper forces. During the days that followed, her close friend was turned into a banshee, and during her escape, she was forced to kill a human ally who was wounded.

persons.name: Jondum Bau
persons.description:
Bau has been primarily investigating [masseffectracker://person?id=S2.Kasumi], but when she sends him a warning about an indoctrinated hanar, he requests Shepard's help to locate and stop the hanar.

 If Shepard did not help Kasumi get the graybox, Bau gets his tip from [megametracker://person?id=E2.Hock] instead, and without Kasumi's help, Shepard will have to choose between saving Bau or the hanar homeworld, Kahje.

persons.name: Bray
persons.description: [Aria's|megametracker://person?id=P2.Aria] bodyguard, Bray accompanies her in the battle to retake Omega and leads a team in the attack.

persons.name: Brynn Cole
persons.description:
Dr. Cole was a Cerberus scientist studying Collector technology. She realized that Cerberus was eliminating scientists once their projects were finished, so she conspired with her remaining colleagues to escape with their families.

 If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Jacob] survived Game 2, she turns to him for help and they strike up a relationship.

persons.name: Anneliese Bryson
persons.description: [Dr. Garret Bryson's|masseffectracker://person?id=O3.GBryson] daughter, Ann assisted in his research for Task Force Aurora. She leads a division called Project Scarab, searching for clues to Leviathan's origin. She was not on the Citadel when her father was killed.

persons.name: Garret Bryson
persons.description: Dr. Bryson was tasked by [masseffectracker://person?id=P1.Hackett] to form a research group investigating ancient legends concerning the Reapers, called Task Force Aurora. They discovered an ancient Reaper-killing creature they called [masseffectracker://person?id=P3.Leviathan]. Unfortunately, Bryson was killed by his indoctrinated assistant, Derek Hadley, leaving the work to his daughter [Ann|masseffectracker://person?id=O3.ABryson].

persons.name: Coats
persons.description: An Alliance soldier in London, Coats spent three days after the Reaper invasion stationed inside Big Ben, shooting at anything that moved. He assists in the final battle for Earth.

persons.name: Corinthus
persons.description: A close friend of Primarch Fedorian, Corinthus informs Shepard of the Primarch's death and asks Shepard to locate the new Primarch, Victus.

persons.name: Urdnot Dagg
persons.description: If Grunt was not admitted to Clan Urdnot in Game 2, or if he died, then Dagg fills his role in Game 3, leading Aralakh Company.

persons.name: Falere
persons.description:
Living at an Ardat-Yakshi monastery with her sister [masseffecttarcker://person?id=O3.Rila], Falere is the last resident to escape the invading Reaper forces. She begs Shepard to help her rescue her sister, but in the end Rila cannot be saved and when the monastery is destroyed, Falere remains in the ruins to honor her vows. 

Falere and Rila are daughters of [megametracker://person?id=S2.Samara].

persons.name: Gryll
persons.description: Formerly the second to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Kreete] in the Blood Pack. When Aria decides to take over the gangs, however, he makes a deal and is "promoted."

persons.name: Jorgal Thurak
persons.description: If [masseffectracker://person?id=S1.Wrex] is not alive in Game 2 or 3, his role is filled by [masseffectracker://person?id=O2.Wreave], and subsequently, Jorgal fills Wreave's role in Game 3.

persons.name: Kalros
persons.description: An ancient thresher maw living under the ruins surrounding the Shroud, Kalros is summoned to attack an attacking Reaper, and - surprisingly enough - she wins.
persons.profession: The Mother of All Thresher Maws

persons.name: Kannik
persons.description: Shopkeeper at Cipritine Armory, Kannik is secretly hoarding high-end, black market weapons. He won't sell to [megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus], however, because he is hedging for the Reapers winning and will only trade the weapons for other goods he thinks he can barter in the chaos after civilization is destroyed.

persons.name: Elijah Khan
persons.description: The source of the weapons used to attack Shepard and Joker at Ryuusei's Sushi Bar. He is very displeased to find out how the weapons were used. He is found dead when Shepard breaks into his office.

persons.name: Kreete
persons.description: Leader of the Blood Pack. When Aria takes over the three gangs, he is taken out in favor of his second, [megametracker://person?id=O3.Gryll].

persons.name: Kurin
persons.description: Stationed on Thessia during the Reaper invasion, Kurin's troops are defending an outpost near the temple of Athane. She intended to order a retreat when Shepard arrived, and due to the urgency of holding open a path to the temple, she continues fighting and as Shepard leaves Thessia, her last, desperate plea for help or information on Shepard's status is heard, before Reaper reinforcements take the area.

persons.name: Narl
persons.description: Aria's contact, Narl has promised the Blood Pack a captive Commander Shepard, but his real plans (or rather, Aria's real plans) are to lure out its leader [megametracker://person?id=O3.Kreete] and kill him.

persons.name: Jordan Noles
persons.description: Noles is working on the Citadel investigating the misuse of batarian diplomatic codes.

persons.name: Jason Prangley
persons.description: Jason is a promising student at Grissom Academy. If Jack died in Game 2, Jason leads and protects the other Cerberus students, and dies just before they reach the shuttles. If Jack is alive, Jason is only singled out from the other students when she mocks him for his weak shields, and he survives the battle. In this case, his survival follows the same rules as Mordin's: if Wrex and Eve are dead, he can be convinced to allow a fake Genophage cure and lives, but in all other scenarios he dies.

persons.name: Rolan Quarn
persons.description: Quarn has a history of tricks and cons before Shepard runs into him during [Khan's|megametracker://person?id=O3.Khan] fundraiser at the Silver Coast casino, assessing the crowd for future marks.

persons.name: Rila
persons.description:
Living at an Ardat-Yakshi monastery with her sister [masseffecttarcker://person?id=O3.Falere], Rila was captured by the invading Reaper forces. Before Shepard can rescue her, she is indoctrinated, but she destroys the monastery and all the Reaper forces before allowing them to convert her into a Banshee. 

Falere and Rila are daughters of [megametracker://person?id=S2.Samara].

persons.name: Lee Riley
persons.description: Hackett says Riley is one of the best of the best engineers in the Alliance. She was sent to Cyone to bring the fuel depot reactors there back online. If Shepard ignores her warning that her team is about to be overrun by Reaper forces, she sacrifices herself to save the others.

persons.name: Kahlee Sanders
persons.description: An old (romantic) friend of [Admiral Anderson|megametracker://person?id=P1.Anderson], Sanders is overseeing the work at Grissom Academy as part of the Ascension Project.  She requests an evacuation of the facility before the Reapers reach it, and if Jack did not survive Game 2, she fills some of that role during the evacuation assignment.
sideEffects: Sanders and Anderson's backstory is told in the novels, *Mass Effect: Revelation*, *Ascension*, and *Retribution*.
Sanders is the daughter of the esteemed Rear Admiral Jon Grissom, for whom Grissom Academy was named, but this is not known to many people.

persons.name: Grace Sato
persons.description: The last surviving person from the communications facility on Ontarom. She hid from Cerberus and, despite being terrified of being discovered, provides Shepard with information to block Cerberus from siezing the facility's data.

persons.name: Sayn
persons.description: A weak-willed second to [megametracker://person?id=O3.Sederis], Sayn can nonetheless be persuaded to take out his boss, with a little prodding.

persons.name: Jona Sederis
persons.description: A ruthless sociopathic killer, Sederis is finally in custody with C-Sec. Aria's deal with her is loyalty in exchange for Jona being released.

persons.name: Shepard (Bootleg) VI
persons.description: It sounds 7% more like Commander Shepard than any other bootleg VI copy-!

persons.name: Aaron Sommers
persons.description: Angry after the Cerberus coup on the Citadel, Sommers leads the mob gathering to kill a traitor who was spared by C-Sec in exchange for intelligence on Cerberus.

persons.name: Talavi
persons.description: A young marine on the Citadel about to deploy with the Alliance Third Fleet against Cerberus, Talavi can be overheard asking for a transfer to a unit facing Reaper combat instead, because her younger brother joined Cerberus and she is worried she might encounter him.
sideEffects: If Shepard approves Talavi's request at the Spectre Console, the Third Fleet suffers heavy casualties.

During [megametracker://mission?id=A3.N7CerberusLab], Shepard encounters two logs from a C. Talavi - presumably Talavi's brother - recounting his arrival at the lab and the Cerberus "integration" completed soon after.

persons.name: Tactus
persons.description: He is protective of the small resources the refugees have and suspicious of any dealings with the Alliance, convinced they will take advantage.

persons.name: Tolan
persons.description: Tolan is part of the team that rescued [megametracker://person?id=O3.Eve] and other krogan cured in Maelon's experiments. He takes [megametracker://person?id=P1.Kirrahe] role, if Kirrahe died in Game 1. He distrusts Shepard and shared [the Dalatrass'|masseffectracker://person?id=P3.Dalatrass] opinion that the Genophage must not be cured.

persons.name: Solik Vass
persons.description: Vass wants to help the war effort by building morale with his films.

persons.name: Vendetta
persons.description: The Prothean VI hiding inside the temple of Athane on Thessia. It holds information on the Crucible.

persons.name: Tarquin Victus
persons.description: Tarquin commands the 9th Platoon. He was sent to resolve a politically sensitive situation on Tuchanka but failed, and lost the respect of his men. In the end, he redeems himself. and dies completing the mission.

persons.name: Darner Vosque
persons.description: Leader of the Blue Suns, Vosk thinks his deal with [megametracker://person?id=P2.Aria] is to force Commander Shepard into killing a thorn in his side, [megametracker://person?id=O1.Septimus], and then to get Aria into bed. Aria suggests that Shepard find a compromise on the first and that Vosk forget about the second entirely.

persons.name: Sarah "Sar" Williams
persons.description: Sarah is [Ashley's|megametracker://person?id=S1.Ashley] younger sister, and can be overheard in Game 1 crushing on Kaidan (or BroShep, if he is romancing Ashley). She was trained in self defense as a girl and married a lieutenant, but never joined the military herself. She and her mother reach the Citadel after the Reaper invasion, but receive news that Sarah's husband was killed in action.
sideEffects: We play a terrible game during Game 3 by ending every mission on the Citadel with: "And then they were harvested when the Reapers took the Citadel." Enjoy!

persons.name: Padok Wiks
persons.description: Padok Wiks is base commander on Sur'Kesh. Unlike many other salarians, Wiks is sympathetic to the krogan. If [megametracker://person?id=S2.Mordin] does not survive Game 2, Wiks also fills that role, accompanying Shepard on the Normandy and synthesizing the Genophage cure from Eve.

persons.name: Zymandis
persons.description: Zymandis soul name is "Regards the Works of the Enkindlers in Despair." He was indoctrinated years earlier in a batarian lab and has created a computer virus to disable planetary defenses on Kahje, the hanar homeworld.
